summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 between FBI Special Agent Michael Livingood and attorney Jacqueline Hudkins. Hudkins, who handled the real estate closing for 338 E. Washington Road in Bradford, NH, contacts the FBI to offer information following the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell at that property. Special Agent Amanda Young is introduced to follow up.

persons.name: Michael Livingood
persons.context: FBI Special Agent based in Boston who is contacted by attorney Jacqueline Hudkins regarding information about the property where Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested. He coordinates follow-up with another agent.

persons.name: Jacqueline Hudkins
persons.context: Attorney who handled the real estate closing for 338 E. Washington Road in Bradford, NH. She reaches out to the FBI after Maxwell's arrest, offering to provide her file and information regarding her legal representation.

persons.name: Amanda Young
persons.context: FBI Special Agent who is cc'd on the email and will follow up directly with Jacqueline Hudkins regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the FBI's investigation. The emails are prompted by her arrest at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, NH, and the attorney involved in that property's closing is offering information to the FBI.

connections.description: Hudkins, an attorney, contacts FBI Special Agent Livingood to offer information related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case, having met him previously at a professional conference.
FBI Special Agents; Livingood introduces Young to follow up directly with attorney Hudkins on the Maxwell matter.
Hudkins handled the real estate closing for the property (338 E. Washington Road) where Maxwell was later arrested.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, New Hampshire.

events.title: Mortgage Banker's Conference
events.description: Michael Livingood and Jacqueline Hudkins met at a Mortgage Banker's conference in Portsmouth, NH.

events.title: Email Correspondence Offering Information
events.description: Attorney Jacqueline Hudkins emails FBI Special Agent Michael Livingood to offer her file and information regarding the property where Maxwell was arrested, leading to coordination for follow-up.

locations: Portsmouth, NH (site of Mortgage Banker's conference)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, at 338 E. Washington Road in Bradford, New Hampshire.
Attorney Jacqueline Hudkins, who handled the real estate closing for that property, proactively contacted the FBI to offer her file and information.
FBI Special Agent Michael Livingood, based in Boston, coordinated the response and introduced Special Agent Amanda Young to follow up directly with Hudkins.
The email chain demonstrates post-arrest investigative activity and coordination between a private attorney with relevant information and federal law enforcement.
